intro: Bridelia sinica, commonly known as Chinese bridelia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture with a slightly serrated margin. Bridelia sinica is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
